author: closer__
content:
<@194432762315407360> we started failing `eth_feeHistory` rpc tests after some recent changes. for example 
```
    "blobGasUsedRatio": [
      -- 0.0 ++ 0
    ],
```
seems like nethermind similarly fails the test due to the mismatch above and different precision. anything we could do to help mitigate these? 
https://hivetests2.ethdevops.io/suite.html?suiteid=1737705701-a9e3f829566e6ec77024817379e0b2a1.json&suitename=rpc-compat#test-28

author: .fjl
content: I will change the JSON comparison in the test to allow for this

author: .fjl
content: It's totally acceptable and the diffing is just too dumb to see these as equivalent

author: .fjl
content: Should be fixed for next run on hivetests2

author: jochembrouwer
content: I was thinking a bit about the comments on the spec visualizer https://ethereum.github.io/execution-apis/api-documentation/ being not super user-friendly to use (too many clicks to get to the info you want). I was thinking about the docs which providers such as metamask gives us: https://docs.metamask.io/services/reference/ethereum/json-rpc-methods/eth_call/. Would this be a good basis? We could try to add a new style to the OpenRPC visualizer which matches such layout

author: .fjl
content: if you can make that work

author: .fjl
content: alternatively, the existing app could be improved to show the information in a more condensed way with less clicking

author: jochembrouwer
content: Cool yeah will do some experimenting ðŸ™‚

author: jochembrouwer
content: Side-note, seems that the auto-deploy of the spec pages doesn't work currently https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/actions/runs/12901090915

author: tersec
content: Those codes should identify the software-as-such
